concept.title: Information designer
concept.shortdesc: Information designers are responsible for defining the look and feel of particular output formats, when they need to deviate from the formats output from the base DITA transforms.

conbody.p:
Information designers need to:
Identify the output and presentation requirements for a particular set of content, and work with the build person to get them implemented.
Design consistent CSS for any unique treatment that the content requires.
Ensure that the design is consistent with user assistance and IBM style guidelines, as well as any branding requirements that apply.

Because DITA separates form from content, information designers can upgrade look and feel by designing new style sheets and output behaviors as required, without asking authors to rework content to achieve different output effects.
